intro: Crocanthemum exaltatum, commonly known as the tall blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, open woodlands. Crocanthemum exaltatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
